tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE SmartGridFaultDetection (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    fault_type VARCHAR(50),
    detection_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    analysis_result TEXT,
    is_resolved BOOL
)

CREATE TABLE smart_grid_fault_detection (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    device_id INT,
    fault_type VARCHAR(50),
    fault_details VARCHAR(100),
    detection_status BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE outage_management (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    affected_devices INT,
    outage_type VARCHAR(50),
    estimated_recovery_time TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE RealTimeData (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    data_type VARCHAR(50),
    data_value FLOAT,
    data_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE FaultDetection (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    fault_type VARCHAR(50),
    detection_method VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE OutageManagement (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    outage_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    affected_area VARCHAR(100),
    outage_cause VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE RealTimeData (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    voltage DECIMAL(10,2),
    current DECIMAL(10,2),
    power DECIMAL(10,2)
);

CREATE TABLE RealTimeData (
    data_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id UUID,
    voltage INT,
    current FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);
